title: English Language Arts: Grade 6
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

093327EDD8DC43DFBFFD04D98533B3AC.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and
phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension
or expression.

FC7BA18E1D804116B7902CDD169926B2.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions)
(e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

9F10F522670D4C6EB98F2064D4EB657E.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to
better understand each of the words.

E59D20A7B1304396B8C6B5CF0C344D07.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification, hyperbole) in context.

10C57EB070384743B06CD2E83703E507.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

BDD14FECBBB24738815C09372E0DCC16.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the
inferred meaning in context or by using other reference materials).

8CC989F4E3964753AE8CBCC7F82548BB.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the pronunciation
of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

6D24B870400948B2AD81850524D2DF25.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a
word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

4563F6BB453A40FFAE93B2EC19E6198E.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function
in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

B73B93AE90844CE6B6525AF2A1AA8C68.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade
6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

B2CC2F969ED2456D906241660CEA6BED.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

C999D329F0D84396A76CB098FD11A906.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

A469DA16DD904B45B7F090725A3AF2AD.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

F869C835D1B247FB9F79C3DAAE37F33D.description: Spell correctly, consulting references as needed.

E0509B16C414408B875CBFAC165CD385.description:
Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical
elements.

863EF59B0F7440D2A4ADBE97200DDD51.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

71165C897BE24E0F9D4F8CFA75AF2BFE.description:
Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others’ writing and speaking, and
identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional language.

F02E25E36CDF4F9093173F56E2BD87B1.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).

4D5A5FAE709A43ABA029555B8A87381E.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

C1CBA6C5DE55438497B4C2A88F370E29.description: Use pronouns in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

B0DE74EA3C474CEBBBD30549FE7A8DDD.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

99082670FA554A778D26F92C6277F518.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, such as conducting interviews and participating in
public performances, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate; use
appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation. (See grade 6 Language standards
1 and 3 for specific expectations)

4F5906E12FEB46D7915106AA9E6C7239.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in
presentations to clarify information.

C874D504B60C41A2B9FB8DB708EC336A.description:
Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and
details to accentuate main ideas or themes appropriate to purpose, audience, and task.

19C32377CA7A4BC28EA39086DC122A7D.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by
reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

46A4A49278974C18BE047AAC4A533693.description:
Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and
explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

21713823B1B6451BBDB019C172D0F1F9.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives
through reflection and paraphrasing.

3A69D1FCE7C74C53BD8418CEF5EA4CDC.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that
contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

63FA86A5E1D44838A91BCF6B20790CA5.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions (e.g., informal consensus, taking votes on key issues,
presentation of alternate views), set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as
needed.

74FA6218045F4F8A8E67D90841C48A8C.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that
preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas
under discussion.

46E07AC4B192413DB8ECE4DBF71575EE.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with
diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their
own clearly.

29009BBA15A34A52A46B99DA869B20ED.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and
audiences.

FB7F1CEA75814F5F9957D81573C50B3E.description:
Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the
argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and
evidence from claims that are not”).

17A9413D053843428FDFE9D14AEE7699.description:
Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast texts in different
forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their
approaches to similar themes and topics”).

3CAFEA04CC554C8483F774FC596CA0E6.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

12D41B58C2244684A5252FB0A3D5D3D3.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each
source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and
providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

D178FCA1CDC9468C93B1C9F5F5738687.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the
inquiry when appropriate.

288F472626F646A98016E1F84B536634.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

8E6FA1BBBAAD481D9D64E0BD51A0346E.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others;
demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills.

58331019ACB546F1BA45C6754FB27F7C.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by
planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should
demonstrate command of Language standards 1– 3 up to and including grade 6.)

072E64AA53D242BBADEBBF4AE320B063.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to
task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–
3 above)

42D12F4EEF6044A69C9A7FCE5AD6D5C6.description: Provide a conclusion that follows the narrated experiences or events.

DDCF81FCEBB942D2BD885E3CA0C59E32.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey
experiences and events.

3FF861E7CA9549E0A7551A19AB560F46.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts
from one time frame or setting to another.

E68B4AE63DA042A989E9ACD24CABDA80.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences,
events, and/or characters.

CF2397052D4349039C1CDC2D61384631.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or
characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

A3955F01225B42968CCC872B20278EBD.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant
descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

C79234206E9F407FB0749D058E533655.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows the information or explanation presented.

510F7EC746994DB5A0F13AC42EA8A5E9.description: Establish and maintain tone and style appropriate to task and audience.

EB463FE145A34DBBAE8C897733BBB67B.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

1CDDA4209F5E4487B08D507A5AF6BE63.description:
Use appropriate transitions, words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among
ideas and concepts.

0CDF18D532B74A97956131D17DEB15FC.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples.

E715A753B7504A3DAB584C6586AF237D.description:
Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition,
classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings),
graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

74B289C7C75648BCA3D0416142D02D11.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information
through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

05ED83B376BE495E8A87B675FEABE6C2.description: Provide a concluding statement or section from the argument presented.

26C7998691414B0F8DBF44CD91BB143E.description: Establish and maintain tone and style appropriate to task and audience.

CA96159F601B480BB3BA4B33AE916946.description:
Use appropriate words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and
reasons.

9B79D2A3BEA646FF88106F84E63AA53B.description:
Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and
demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

B1A5C330F6FC4274B33AC2118C8816A6.description: Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

1DEA462D982F49AE81EB38746097EF29.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

E541E240083948E596FE3E0EFFB3E1E4.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6–8 text complexity band
proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

E55867AB81A44DB6B4DDDF2680793870.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

2A60A0A68C2E495ABE0C9FB15AB24BD3.description:
Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written
by and a biography on the same person).

AF279EEE8FA5427BB818BB22274285E4.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are
supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

24AFF802C34D41B78964B15BB4646510.description:
Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in
words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

86FC3D8A6AAF46CAB3A7CE2902BEE492.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

176C615A9AC94F5989B722C1D400C828.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text
and contributes to the development of the ideas.

8AD7887ECCA740B0B69073800226A547.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative,
connotative, and technical meanings.

0338FBD6A5814D0E80BD03BFD3772163.description:
Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text
(e.g., through specific text examples).

9F2369BF481B4C179988B9DE31AD5FCD.description: Provide an objective summary of the text that includes the central idea and relevant details.

9FF31016C0D148D9B0FA45BF2B229524.description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details.

E2EE00F9161A4BD4ACD84C39DDD60D3E.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn
from the text.

B2AD356EB38B488F81A8E984B4F826C4.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the
grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

87969F4184474207A7ABE9470669C3BB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B1DF654BEC2D47AC8DC01F2F7F5B1171.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and
fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

9E80173D8F9A49C2858DCF47C14CC6E6.description:
Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an
audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading
the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

EF08C1F9B5F147699F655E2494D20A0C.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view and/or perspective of the narrator or speaker in a text.

7960454B59174D1CA4A2A50FDADACF7B.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and
contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

59C1130122EF48259A2DA49C77835C65.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and
connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

0F7FA6272B054AEFBA0041A0BF5099BA.description:
Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the
characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

745AD70F7AA14D49A491393EE7699B52.description: Incorporate a theme and story details into an objective summary of the text.

60C268228CD049A097EFB0B09CF132ED.description: Determine a theme of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details.

6FB02C6A32E24B3B8032A825145A6B10.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn
from the text.
